revised_title: Ionic Movements and Electrical Activity in Giant Nerve Fibers
tldr: This article discusses the relationship between ionic movements and electrical activity in giant nerve fibers. The authors, A. L. Hodgkin and F. R. S., explore the effects of sodium ions on various tissues and how they contribute to the transmission of nerve impulses. They also compare the effects of different substances on nerve fibers, such as choline, sucrose, and other quarternary ammonium salts.
